definition: to make a breakthrough/to break through/to breach (military)
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

sentences.english: The kingdom was conquered by the Mongol and Chinese armies of Kublai Khan .
sentences.chinese: 大理王国后来被忽必烈率领的蒙古族和汉族军队攻破。

sentences.english: But in the 59th minute, Corradi attacks the worn-out host front door tying score.
sentences.chinese: 而在第59分钟，科拉迪攻破旧主大门追平比分。

sentences.english: A lair of illegal activities conducting forged documents was destroyed by the police.
sentences.chinese: 一个办理假证件的黑户被警方攻破。

sentences.english: And he shall set engines of war against thy walls, and with his axes he shall break down thy towers.
sentences.chinese: 他必安设撞城锤攻破你的墙垣，用铁器拆毁你的城楼。

sentences.english: God and pull down the strongholds.
sentences.chinese: 然后用神话语的宝剑攻破这些营垒。

sentences.english: The easiest way to capture a fortress is from within.
sentences.chinese: 堡垒是最容易从内部攻破的。

sentences.english: The Chinese rice sends 4 vanguards finally, but is unable to attack the Genoa gate.
sentences.chinese: 国米最后派上4名前锋，但就是无法攻破热那亚球门。

sentences.english: The toyaku line should be breached .
Soon be breached, a surname city Song Xiangxian died.
sentences.chinese: 东莱城很快被攻破，宋象贤战死。

sentences.english: They kept bringing pressure on Lot and moved forward to break down the door.
sentences.chinese: 众人就向前拥挤罗得，要攻破房门。

sentences.english: Your heart's tall city, when I can break.
sentences.chinese: 你心里的那座城池，我什么时候能攻破。

sentences.english: Hleb could slip a pass to the Spaniard who lashed his shot past Schmeichel.
sentences.chinese: 赫莱布传球，西班牙人射门攻破了舒梅切尔的十指关。

sentences.english: When their flags and pennants are in chaos, their men and horses frequently shifting about, then strike into them.
sentences.chinese: 敌人旌旗紊乱，人马不断调动，就来机攻破它。

sentences.english: It is below the offensive with my powerful army, xu water city is very fast by breach.
sentences.chinese: 在我军强大的攻势下，徐水城很快就被攻破。

sentences.english: One option a thief might try to crack your password is a brute-force dictionary attack .
sentences.chinese: 一个选项一个小偷可能企图攻破密码是强力字典攻击。

sentences.english: Chelsea had a close call when the bottom-placed Portsmouth almost scored.
sentences.chinese: 英超排名垫底的朴茨茅斯险些攻破切尔西的球门。

definition: to overcome/to take (a fortress)/to fall (to an attack)/to surrender
to force entrance into/to score a goal (sport)
secure as a city protected by a wall of metal and a moat of boiling water (idiom)/well fortified/invulnerable to attack
to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
to seize/to capture/to wrest control of
to attack for a long time without success
